Understanding Chronic Back Pain

Chronic back pain is defined as back pain lasting more than 12 weeks. Unlike acute back pain from a specific injury, chronic back pain often persists even after the original injury has healed.

Common Causes

  • Herniated or bulging discs
  • Degenerative disc disease
  • Arthritis and joint inflammation
  • Muscle strain and spasms
  • Poor posture and ergonomics
  • Spinal stenosis

When Traditional Treatment May Be More Appropriate

We believe in transparent, honest information. Traditional treatments may be better suited if:

  • You have acute injury requiring immediate intervention: Recent injuries or acute conditions may benefit from immediate medical attention.
  • Structural issues require surgical correction: Certain spinal conditions may genuinely require surgical intervention.
  • You need quick symptom relief: Medications can provide rapid (though temporary) pain reduction for immediate needs.
  • Insurance coverage is a primary concern: Traditional treatments are more likely to be covered by insurance.

Can You Use Both?

Yes! Many clients use EES alongside traditional treatments. EES can:

  • Enhance healing between physical therapy sessions
  • Reduce need for pain medications over time
  • Support recovery from surgical procedures
  • Address underlying cellular health while other treatments manage symptoms

Consider integrating EES with your current treatment plan, working with your healthcare provider.
